def: One who argued moot cases in the inns of court.
In a sore manner; grievously; painfully; as, to be sorelyafflicted.
Demonstrative warmth or cordiality of manner; display ofenthusiasm.
One liable to the fault of heterophemy.
Of or pertaining to a tribe (Zalambdodonta) of Insectivora inwhich the molar teeth have but one V-shaped ridge.
An apparatus for determining the temperature of a distantpoint, as by a thermoelectric circuit or otherwise.
One who takes care of baggage; a camp follower. [Obs.] Sir W.Raleigh.
An intermeddling with the affairs of another, either on legalgrounds or without authority.
Old Norse poetry expressed in runes.Runes were upon his tongue, As on the warrior's sword. Longfellow.Rune stone, a stone bearing a runic inscription.
